intro: Lachenalia polypodantha subsp. polypodantha, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It blooms during the summer months, producing clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers.
